parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "LAMMPS",
  "software": [
    "Spack",
    "Slurm",
    "GCC",
    "OpenMPI",
    "CUDA",
    "OpenBLAS",
    "FFTW",
    "Kokkos",
    "FFmpeg",
    "Plumed",
    "Python"
  ],
  "resources": {
    "nodes": 1,
    "tasks_per_node": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 10,
    "memory": "93G",
    "gpus": 1,
    "time": "48:00:00"
  }
}
```

The script runs a LAMMPS simulation using the Spack package manager on a Slurm cluster. It installs and configures LAMMPS with various dependencies, including GCC, OpenMPI, CUDA, OpenBLAS, FFTW, Kokkos, FFmpeg, Plumed, and Python. It then launches the LAMMPS simulation using the Slurm job scheduler with specific resource requirements: 1 node, 1 task per node, 10 CPUs per task, 93 GB of memory, 1 GPU, and a maximum runtime of 48 hours.
